message:
Microsoft is finally killing support for old versions of Internet Explorer

Starting from: January 12th, 2016

"Only the most recent version of Internet Explorer available for a supported operating system will receive technical support and security updates,"
caption: Attachment UnavailableThis attachment may have been removed or the person who shared it may not have permission to share it with you.

data.message: as if it matters ... killing support isn't the problem, you can't get the users to update their old browsers because it is bounded to the OS updates which is disabled by most users who use pirated version.

Of course it matters :) - I've heard a lot of times that "We need to support IE7 or IE8 cause this web app will run on corporate machines".
And this will ensure that system admins will need (forced) to update the browser
And in all cases it's a good news for all of the web developers
Bro, this wont force them to update their browsers cause the machines they are using are not capable of running higher versions of IE cause of the OS itself :)
We use IE7 at work ... and some people ask me to check stuff for IE6. Some agencies are required to support *all* browsers ... because of the sensitivity of their *content*.
I don't care about pirates. I care about corporate users whose corporate kept old IE to be used internally. Hopefully those *may* be affected
And by the way almost 22% of the world still using IE
